text: Clock Cleaners is a 1937 American animated short movie. It was produced by Walt Disney Productions. It was released by RKO Radio Pictures. The cartoon follows Mickey Mouse, Donald Duck, and Goofy working as janitors in a tall clock tower. The movie was directed by Ben Sharpsteen. The music was written by Paul Smith and Oliver Wallace. The voice cast includes Walt Disney as Mickey, Clarence Nash as Donald, and Pinto Colvig as Goofy.Clock Cleaners at The Encyclopedia of Animated Disney ShortsClock Cleaners at the Big Cartoon DataBase It was the 97th short in the Mickey Mouse movie series to be released. ==Cast== *Walt Disney as Mickey Mouse *Clarence Nash as Donald Duck *Pinto Colvig as Goofy ==Releases== *1937 - theatrical release *1950 - One Hour in Wonderland (TV) *1972 - The Mouse Factory, episode #15: "Back to Nature" (TV) *c. 1983 - Good Morning, Mickey!, episode #56 (TV) *1986 - theatrical re-release with The Great Mouse Detective *1990 - "Goofy's Guide to Success" (TV) *c. 1992 - Mickey's Mouse Tracks, episode #77 (TV) *c. 1992 - Donald's Quack Attack, episode #60 (TV) *1997 - The Ink and Paint Club, episode #1.22: "Classic Mickey" (TV) *2010 - Have a Laugh!, episode #7 (TV) ==Home media== The short was released on December 4, 2001, on Walt Disney Treasures: Mickey Mouse in Living Color.
